title: Black Jack Gum label type circa 70s??
content:
Hi everyone.

I'm trying to find the typeface used in this\* great old gum wrapper for a friend.  
My guess is that I won't find the specific type, with it's quirky spirals, but if you can point me toward the root font of this face I'd appreciate it.

\* [http://www.victoryseeds.com/candystore/images/adams/blackjack\_70s.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.victoryseeds.com/candystore/images/adams/blackjack_70s.JPG "http://www.victoryseeds.com/candystore/images/adams/blackjack\_70s.JPG")

I'm looking for the main "Black Jack" face, not the sans serif, though that is a really nice one too.

Thanks in advance for any help.

-JB
author: Jonathan Bennett

comments.content:
Hilarious. Reminds me of [this LP cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/37558743/) I found last year.

It's unlikely, indeed that you'll find a digital font like this. [Edison](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/edison-swirl-sg/?refby=typographica) has your swirls, but it's a very different style of face.
[Bodoni Classic Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/bodoni-classic/) has some of the same feel.

Pink Mouse from BA Graphics is also close:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/pink-mouse/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/pink-mouse/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/pink-mouse/")

[Beatnik](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/beatnik/), if you added the swirls, would be close because of the bouncy baseline, but I think it's closer to [Bodoni Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/bodoni-rr-campanile/). I linked to the Red Rooster version, but there's one from pretty much any foundry that has done a Bodoni.

I'm sure a revival of this style is coming very soon, and then you will be drowning in alternatives.

Sean Glenn  
Art Director  
 [www.superunicorn.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020161627/http:/www.superunicorn.com/ "www.superunicorn.com")
